item.title: Shilpa Medicare Gets European Approval for Rotigotine Transdermal Patch
item.description: Top News Shilpa Medicare Gets European Approval for Rotigotine Transdermal Patch 1 minute ago Shilpa Medicare has received its first European approval for the Rotigotine transdermal patch, a neurological treatment product. The company plans to launch the product by FY27, targeting a market potential of approximately USD 222 million. This approval marks Shilpa Medicare's entry into the European market for specialized neurological treatments and showcases its capability to develop complex pharmaceutical products meeting European standards.

item.title: Trade Setup: Global Cues and Corporate Actions Shape Market Sentiment
item.description: Trade Setup: Global Cues and Corporate Actions Shape Market Sentiment 3 hours ago GIFT Nifty futures down 0.02% at 26,129.00, indicating a flat to slightly negative opening. US markets closed mixed, with Dow up 1.34% and NASDAQ down 0.24%. Asian markets show positive trends. Crude oil up 0.73%, while gold and silver decline. USD/INR trading at 90.30, up 0.09%. FIIs sold ₹2,020.94 crore, while DIIs bought ₹3,796.07 crore on 11-12-2025. Notable block deals in UFLEX, Yes Bank, and Gallantt Ispat. Key corporate actions include EGMs for several companies and NACL Industries' rights issue.

item.title: Reliance Retail Considers IPO Within Three Years
item.description: Reliance Retail Considers IPO Within Three Years 3 hours ago Reliance Retail, India's largest retail chain and a subsidiary of Reliance Industries, has announced plans to potentially launch an Initial Public Offering (IPO) within the next three years. This move could provide investors an opportunity to participate in India's retail sector growth, enhance the company's access to capital, and increase operational transparency. As India's largest retail chain, Reliance Retail's potential IPO could be a significant event in the Indian market.

item.title: Max India Limited Allots 20,000 Equity Shares Under Employee Stock Option Plan
item.description: Max India Limited Allots 20,000 Equity Shares Under Employee Stock Option Plan 38 minutes ago Max India Limited allotted 20,000 equity shares under its ESOP Plan 2020 to eligible employees on December 12, 2025. The allotment increased the company's paid-up capital from ₹52.43 crores to ₹52.45 crores, with total equity shares rising to 5,24,50,362. The company made the disclosure in compliance with SEBI regulations to both stock exchanges.
